forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely and areas of fog before 5am, then areas of fog and a chance of rain. Cloudy. Low around 28, with temperatures rising to around 38 overnight. South wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Fog then Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog and a chance of rain before 10am, then rain and areas of fog. Cloudy, with a high near 53. South wind around 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the stillness of the early morning, Boston is enveloped in a hazy embrace, with rain likely listening patiently for its cue before dawn breaks. The fog cloaks the city, a soft veil that hints at the quiet pulses of life beneath. As the hours unfurl, the temperature will gradually rise, lifting spirits out of the chill of the low twenties to a slightly more amiable thirty-eight. Allow the light winds from the south to brush against your coat as you step outside, but be prepared for the inevitable rain that is destined to greet the day.

By midday, the fog will intertwine with steady rain, bringing a somber yet tranquil ambiance to the bustling streets. The clouds hang low, heavy with the promise of moisture, rendering umbrellas a must-have accessory for any endeavor outside. For those not inclined to brave the elements, perhaps now is the perfect time to indulge in the comforts of home—snuggle up with a good book, savor a warm cup of tea, or catch up on films you’ve been meaning to watch. If you venture out, dress warmly and consider layering, ensuring that you can find comfort before the warmth of indoor spaces calls you back. The day may lean towards the dreary side, but such is winter in New England—a reminder to embrace the gentle, soft-spoken beauty of this muted season.
